article: Making friends is a skill. Like most skills, it improves with practice. If you want to meet people and make friends, _ must be willing to take actions. You must first go to the place _ are people. You won t make friends _ home alone. _ a club or group, for talking with those who like the same things as you do is _ . Or join someone in some activity. Many people are nervous when talking to people. After all, meeting strangers means facing _ . And it s human _ to feel a bit uncomfortable about the unknown. Most of our fears about dealing with new people _ doubts about ourselves. We imagine other people are judging us, _ us too tall or too short, too this or too that. _ don t forget that they must be feeling _ way as you. Try to accept yourself _ you are, and try to put the other person at ease. You will _ feel more comfortable. Try to act self-confident even if you don t feel that way. _ you enter a room full of strangers, such as a new classroom, walk tall and straight, look _ at other people and smile. If you see someone you d like to _ to, say something. Don t wait for the other person to _ a conversation. Just meeting someone _ doesn t mean that you will make friends with that person. Friendship is _ on mutual liking and give and take . They take time and _ to develop. And there are things that keep a new friendship from growing
